intro: Gentianella corallina, commonly known as coral gentian, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually unbranched and erect. Gentianella corallina is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant, showy blooms.
